next.text: Hi Thanh.  Things are going well.  Iâ€™m planning to start working abroad soon.
Yeah, I wanted to ask you what you heard from her.

10.text: Thatâ€™s what my cousin said.  Maybe it was just some random thing, butâ€¦ well, it made me more wary.  Still, it is cheaper and easier to get a job there than Japan by a long shot.

next.text: What made her decide to go to Japan?
Did she go through the government or a broker?

2.text: Sure, what do you want to know?

4.text: She did some research on working in Japan versus Taiwan.  Pay is a lot better for most of the Japanese jobs.  She spoke some Japanese too.  But it was more expensive than Taiwan.

6.text: From what I recall, her employers would occasionally hold some of her overtime pay and werenâ€™t very pleasant to deal with.  But she was able to get what she was owed with some arguing.

7.text: There are more requirements, too.  Thereâ€™s a lower threshold of skill levels for Taiwanese jobs, generally.

8.text: Yeah.  My sister had a trickier time finding work and dealing with the price.  Sheâ€™s a bit younger than us, less commitments, so she could take her time to do it.  She had to borrow some money.

9.text: A fair bit.  I think it was worth it, though.  Iâ€™ve heard that the work can be a lot rougher in Taiwan.  I had a cousin who went there and apparently got their identification papers taken while they were working.
